demo-store.description:
Create a demo store using Chec and Commerce.js
This command will download an example project from GitHub and initialise it on your machine. You will be free to edit the downloaded code and play around with Commerce.js in client code

env.name: env
env.description: Extra env variables to set for a .env file in the installed project

no-login.name: no-login
no-login.description: Optionally skip the login requirement. This is likely to be incompatible with example stores that are available for download

no-seed.name: no-seed
no-seed.description: Optionally skip seeding sample data into your Chec account

domain.name: domain
domain.description: The base URL for the Chec API

args.name: store
args.description: The store that you want your example based off of

args.name: targetDirectory
args.description: The destination directory name to download the example to. The defaults to the store name

log.description:
Get full detail about a given log ID
Communicates with Chec to get full log information for the given log ID

raw.name: raw
raw.description: Display a "raw" unformatted JSON blob of the log details

utc.name: utc
utc.description: Display timestamps in UTC timezone instead of the local timezone

domain.name: domain
domain.description: The base URL for the Chec API

args.name: logId
args.description: The log ID for the log entry you want to retrieve

login.description:
Log into your Chec account
Log into your Chec account to enable commands that require API access.

skip-check.name: skip-check
skip-check.description: Indicate that this command should skip checking if a user is already logged in

domain.name: domain
domain.description: The base URL for the Chec API

logout.description:
Log out of your account
Log out of your account and remove the local copy of your API keys.

logs.description:
Show a summary of your API requests processed by Chec.
Listens for logs from Chec and displays a summary of them to you as they are processed by Chec.
You may optionally retrieve prior logs and navigate through shown logs to fetch further details about the log entry from Chec.

tail.name: tail
tail.description: Show the last n number of logs before listening for new logs

follow.name: follow
follow.description: "Follow" logs from Chec. New events that happen are shown live

history.name: history
history.description: Keep record of the given number of logs when browsing back.

domain.name: domain
domain.description: The base URL for the Chec API

register.description:
Register an account with Chec
Sign up for a Chec account through your browser

domain.name: domain
domain.description: The base URL for the Chec API

request.description:
Run abstract API request
Runs an arbitrary API request given the HTTP method, endpoint, and input payload.

Data should be provided as a JSON object. You may also use `--sandbox` to use
sandbox API keys.

domain.name: domain
domain.description: The base URL for the Chec API

file.name: file
file.description: Optional: path to JSON encoded file containing request payload

whoami.description:
Get information on your user account
Fetches information on your user account, and merchants associated with your account.

domain.name: domain
domain.description: The base URL for the Chec API
